verses.kjv: Now king David was old and stricken in years; and they covered him with clothes, but he gat no heat.
verses.ct: King David had grown very old, and even though his servants piled blankets on him, he could not stay warm.

verses.kjv: Wherefore his servants said unto him, Let there be sought for my lord the king a young virgin: and let her stand before the king, and let her cherish him, and let her lie in thy bosom, that my lord the king may get heat.
verses.ct: So his servants suggested, "Let us find a young woman for our lord the king. She can attend to you and lie close to you so that you, our lord the king, can stay warm."

verses.kjv: So they sought for a fair damsel throughout all the coasts of Israel, and found Abishag a Shunammite, and brought her to the king.
verses.ct: They searched all throughout Israel for a beautiful young woman, and they found Abishag the Shunammite and brought her to the king.

verses.kjv: And the damsel was very fair, and cherished the king, and ministered to him: but the king knew her not.
verses.ct: The young woman was extremely beautiful. She took care of the king and waited on him, but the king did not have relations with her.

verses.kjv: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, I will be king: and he prepared him chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Adonijah, the son of Haggith, promoted himself, declaring, "I will be king." He arranged for chariots, horsemen, and 50 men to run ahead of him.

verses.kjv: And his father had not displeased him at any time in saying, Why hast thou done so? and he also was a very goodly man; and his mother bare him after Absalom.
verses.ct: His father had never challenged him at any point by asking, "Why are you doing this?" Adonijah was also very handsome, and his mother had given birth to him after Absalom.

verses.kjv: And he conferred with Joab the son of Zeruiah, and with Abiathar the priest: and they following Adonijah helped him.
verses.ct: He consulted with Joab son of Zeruiah and with Abiathar the priest, and they gave him their support.

verses.kjv: But Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and Nathan the prophet, and Shimei, and Rei, and the mighty men which belonged to David, were not with Adonijah.
verses.ct: However, Zadok the priest, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, Nathan the prophet, Shimei, Rei, and David's elite warriors did not side with Adonijah.

verses.kjv: And Adonijah slew sheep and oxen and fat cattle by the stone of Zoheleth, which is by Enrogel, and called all his brethren the king’s sons, and all the men of Judah the king’s servants:
verses.ct: Adonijah sacrificed sheep, cattle, and fattened calves at the Stone of Zoheleth near En Rogel. He invited all his brothers — the king's sons — and all the officials of Judah who served the king.

verses.kjv: But Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah, and the mighty men, and Solomon his brother, he called not.
verses.ct: But he did not invite Nathan the prophet, Benaiah, the elite warriors, or his brother Solomon.

verses.kjv: Wherefore Nathan spake unto Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, saying, Hast thou not heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith doth reign, and David our lord knoweth it not?
verses.ct: So Nathan spoke to Bathsheba, Solomon's mother, and asked, "Have you heard that Adonijah son of Haggith has made himself king, and our lord David doesn't even know about it?"

verses.kjv: Now therefore come, let me, I pray thee, give thee counsel, that thou mayest save thine own life, and the life of thy son Solomon.
verses.ct: "Now then, let me give you some advice so you can save your own life and the life of your son Solomon."

verses.kjv: Go and get thee in unto king David, and say unto him, Didst not thou, my lord, O king, swear unto thine handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne? why then doth Adonijah reign?
verses.ct: "Go to King David and say to him, 'My lord the king, didn't you make an oath to your servant, promising that my son Solomon would rule after you and sit on your throne? Then why has Adonijah become king?'"

verses.kjv: Behold, while thou yet talkest there with the king, I also will come in after thee, and confirm thy words.
verses.ct: "While you are still speaking with the king, I will come in behind you and back up everything you say."

verses.kjv: And Bathsheba went in unto the king into the chamber: and the king was very old; and Abishag the Shunammite ministered unto the king.
verses.ct: So Bathsheba went to the king in his bedroom. The king was very old, and Abishag the Shunammite was attending to him.

verses.kjv: And Bathsheba bowed, and did obeisance unto the king. And the king said, What wouldest thou?
verses.ct: Bathsheba knelt and bowed low before the king. The king asked, "What do you want?"

verses.kjv: And she said unto him, My lord, thou swarest by the LORD thy God unto thine handmaid, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne.
verses.ct: She answered him, "My lord, you swore to your servant by the LORD your God, saying, 'Your son Solomon will certainly rule after me and sit on my throne.'"

verses.kjv: And now, behold, Adonijah reigneth; and now, my lord the king, thou knowest it not:
verses.ct: "But now, look — Adonijah has made himself king, and you, my lord the king, don't even know about it."

verses.kjv: And he hath slain oxen and fat cattle and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the sons of the king, and Abiathar the priest, and Joab the captain of the host: but Solomon thy servant hath he not called.
verses.ct: "He has sacrificed large numbers of cattle, fattened calves, and sheep, and has invited all the king's sons, along with Abiathar the priest and Joab the army commander. But he did not invite your servant Solomon."

verses.kjv: And thou, my lord, O king, the eyes of all Israel are upon thee, that thou shouldest tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
verses.ct: "My lord the king, all of Israel is watching you, waiting for you to announce who will sit on the throne of my lord the king after him."

verses.kjv: Otherwise it shall come to pass, when my lord the king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon shall be counted offenders.
verses.ct: "If you don't act, then when my lord the king dies and joins his ancestors, my son Solomon and I will be treated as criminals."

verses.kjv: And, lo, while she yet talked with the king, Nathan the prophet also came in.
verses.ct: While she was still talking with the king, Nathan the prophet arrived.

verses.kjv: And they told the king, saying, Behold Nathan the prophet. And when he was come in before the king, he bowed himself before the king with his face to the ground.
verses.ct: The king was told, "Nathan the prophet is here." When Nathan came into the king's presence, he bowed down with his face to the ground.

verses.kjv: And Nathan said, My lord, O king, hast thou said, Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne?
verses.ct: Nathan said, "My lord the king, did you declare that Adonijah would rule after you and sit on your throne?"

verses.kjv: For he is gone down this day, and hath slain oxen and fat cattle and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the king’s sons, and the captains of the host, and Abiathar the priest; and, behold, they eat and drink before him, and say, God save king Adonijah.
verses.ct: "Because today he went down and sacrificed large numbers of cattle, fattened calves, and sheep. He invited all the king's sons, the army commanders, and Abiathar the priest. Right now they are eating and drinking with him and shouting, 'Long live King Adonijah!'"

verses.kjv: But me, even me thy servant, and Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and thy servant Solomon, hath he not called.
verses.ct: "But he did not invite me — your servant — or Zadok the priest, or Benaiah son of Jehoiada, or your servant Solomon."

verses.kjv: Is this thing done by my lord the king, and thou hast not shewed it unto thy servant, who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?
verses.ct: "Was this done by my lord the king without telling your servant who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?"

verses.kjv: Then king David answered and said, Call me Bathsheba. And she came into the king’s presence, and stood before the king.
verses.ct: King David responded, "Bring Bathsheba to me." So she came into the king's presence and stood before him.

verses.kjv: And the king sware, and said, As the LORD liveth, that hath redeemed my soul out of all distress,
verses.ct: The king made an oath and said, "As surely as the LORD lives — the one who has rescued my soul from every trouble —

verses.kjv: Even as I sware unto thee by the LORD God of Israel, saying, Assuredly Solomon thy son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne in my stead; even so will I certainly do this day.
verses.ct: just as I swore to you by the LORD, the God of Israel, saying, 'Your son Solomon will certainly rule after me and sit on my throne in my place' — I will carry that out this very day."

verses.kjv: Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to the earth, and did reverence to the king, and said, Let my lord king David live for ever.
verses.ct: Bathsheba bowed down with her face to the ground and paid honor to the king, saying, "May my lord King David live forever!"

verses.kjv: And king David said, Call me Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada. And they came before the king.
verses.ct: Then King David said, "Summon Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah son of Jehoiada." They came before the king.

verses.kjv: The king also said unto them, Take with you the servants of your lord, and cause Solomon my son to ride upon mine own mule, and bring him down to Gihon:
verses.ct: The king told them, "Take your lord's officials with you, have my son Solomon ride on my own mule, and escort him down to Gihon."

verses.kjv: And let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anoint him there king over Israel: and blow ye with the trumpet, and say, God save king Solomon.
verses.ct: "There, Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet are to anoint him as king over Israel. Then blow the trumpet and shout, 'Long live King Solomon!'"

verses.kjv: Then ye shall come up after him, that he may come and sit upon my throne; for he shall be king in my stead: and I have appointed him to be ruler over Israel and over Judah.
verses.ct: "After that, follow him back here so he can come and sit on my throne, because he will be king in my place. I have appointed him to be ruler over Israel and Judah."

verses.kjv: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king, and said, Amen: the LORD God of my lord the king say so too.
verses.ct: Benaiah son of Jehoiada replied to the king, "Amen! May the LORD, the God of my lord the king, confirm it."

verses.kjv: As the LORD hath been with my lord the king, even so be he with Solomon, and make his throne greater than the throne of my lord king David.
verses.ct: "Just as the LORD has been with my lord the king, may he also be with Solomon, and may he make Solomon's throne even greater than the throne of my lord King David."

verses.kjv: So Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, went down, and caused Solomon to ride upon king David’s mule, and brought him to Gihon.
verses.ct: So Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and Pelethites went down. They had Solomon ride on King David's mule and brought him to Gihon.

verses.kjv: And Zadok the priest took an horn of oil out of the tabernacle, and anointed Solomon. And they blew the trumpet; and all the people said, God save king Solomon.
verses.ct: Zadok the priest took the horn of oil from the tabernacle and anointed Solomon. They blew the trumpet, and all the people shouted, "Long live King Solomon!"

verses.kjv: And all the people came up after him, and the people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth rent with the sound of them.
verses.ct: Then all the people followed him back, playing flutes and celebrating with such tremendous joy that the ground shook from the noise.

verses.kjv: And Adonijah and all the guests that were with him heard it as they had made an end of eating. And when Joab heard the sound of the trumpet, he said, Wherefore is this noise of the city being in an uproar?
verses.ct: Adonijah and all his guests heard the commotion just as they were finishing their meal. When Joab heard the trumpet blast, he asked, "What is all this uproar in the city about?"

verses.kjv: And while he yet spake, behold, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came; and Adonijah said unto him, Come in; for thou art a valiant man, and bringest good tidings.
verses.ct: While he was still speaking, Jonathan son of Abiathar the priest arrived. Adonijah said to him, "Come in! You're a respected man — you must be bringing good news."

verses.kjv: And Jonathan answered and said to Adonijah, Verily our lord king David hath made Solomon king.
verses.ct: Jonathan answered Adonijah, "Not at all! Our lord King David has made Solomon king."

verses.kjv: And the king hath sent with him Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, and they have caused him to ride upon the king’s mule:
verses.ct: "The king sent Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and Pelethites with him, and they had him ride on the king's mule."

verses.kjv: And Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king in Gihon: and they are come up from thence rejoicing, so that the city rang again. This is the noise that ye have heard.
verses.ct: "Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet anointed him as king at Gihon. They came back from there celebrating, and the whole city is buzzing with excitement. That's the noise you've been hearing."

verses.kjv: And also Solomon sitteth on the throne of the kingdom.
verses.ct: "What's more, Solomon has already taken his seat on the royal throne."

verses.kjv: And moreover the king’s servants came to bless our lord king David, saying, God make the name of Solomon better than thy name, and make his throne greater than thy throne. And the king bowed himself upon the bed.
verses.ct: "On top of that, the king's officials came to congratulate our lord King David, saying, 'May God make Solomon's name even more famous than yours, and may he make his throne greater than your throne.' And the king bowed in worship on his bed."

verses.kjv: And also thus said the king, Blessed be the LORD God of Israel, which hath given one to sit on my throne this day, mine eyes even seeing it.
verses.ct: "The king also said, 'Praise the LORD, the God of Israel, who has provided someone to sit on my throne today while I can still see it with my own eyes.'"

verses.kjv: And all the guests that were with Adonijah were afraid, and rose up, and went every man his way.
verses.ct: At this, all of Adonijah's guests panicked. They got up and scattered, each going his own way.

verses.kjv: And Adonijah feared because of Solomon, and arose, and went, and caught hold on the horns of the altar.
verses.ct: Adonijah was terrified of Solomon, so he rushed to the tabernacle and grabbed hold of the horns of the altar.

verses.kjv: And it was told Solomon, saying, Behold, Adonijah feareth king Solomon: for, lo, he hath caught hold on the horns of the altar, saying, Let king Solomon swear unto me today that he will not slay his servant with the sword.
verses.ct: Solomon was told, "Adonijah is afraid of King Solomon. He has grabbed the horns of the altar and is saying, 'Let King Solomon swear to me today that he will not execute his servant with the sword.'"

verses.kjv: And Solomon said, If he will shew himself a worthy man, there shall not an hair of him fall to the earth: but if wickedness shall be found in him, he shall die.
verses.ct: Solomon replied, "If he proves himself to be an honorable man, not a single hair on his head will be harmed. But if any wrongdoing is found in him, he will die."

verses.kjv: So king Solomon sent, and they brought him down from the altar. And he came and bowed himself to king Solomon: and Solomon said unto him, Go to thine house.
verses.ct: So King Solomon sent men to bring him down from the altar. Adonijah came and bowed before King Solomon, and Solomon told him, "Go home."
